text: But can you clarify what is a “standard update”, or what is being updated?  I need to be able to communicate internally to assure others that no information regarding this private code is available to the outside world (not my ideal mode of operation, but….)

elements.text: But can you clarify what is a “standard update”, or what is being updated?  I need to be able to communicate internally to assure others that no information regarding this private code is available to the outside world (not my ideal mode of operation, but….)

text: It is the same think that happens when you do `]update` : it connects to the general registry and pulls all the names of the packages that exist, as well as their versions. So when you ask for `]add SomePackage`, the package manager looks in the downloaded list and knows where to pull it from. I.e. nothing to do with you package but with the ones that are intentionally registered.
